info.title: 0CodeKit API

post.description: Creates a summary of the given text.

parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

prompt.example: Once upon a time, in a far away land, there lived a young girl who was full of dreams and aspirations. She was passionate about exploring the world and discovering all its secrets. She wanted to see the wonders of the world, to meet new people, to learn new things, and to experience life in all its glory. As a young girl, she often thought of what it would be like to journey to exotic places, to explore the unknown and to find her place in the world. She wanted to be free to make her own decisions, to choose her own destiny, and to be independent. ne day, she decided she was ready to embark on her quest. She packed her bags, said goodbye to her family, and set off on her travels. She went to places she had only dreamed of, and experienced things she had never imagined. She met people from all walks of life, made new friends, and experienced new cultures. She explored the great outdoors and embraced nature in all its beauty. She tried new foods, and found her favorite cuisines. Through it all, she found her own path and discovered her true purpose in life.

id.description: The ID of the generated content.

data.example: A young girl with dreams of exploring the world and experiencing life's wonders embarks on a journey to exotic places. She meets people from different cultures, tries new foods, and enjoys nature's beauty. Throughout her travels, she finds her own path and discovers her true purpose in life.

csv.description: The CSV string that will be converted.

noheader.description: If this is false, the first line will be interpreted as column names instead of data. Default is false.

trim.description: Whether spaces around column values should be trimmed. Default is true.

ignoreEmpty.description: Whether empty column values should be ignored, instead of being output as empty. Default is false.

json.description: An array of JSON objects parsed from the CSV.

range.description: The range of the generated number. The first number is the minimum, the second is the maximum.

type.description: The type of generated number. Default is `integer`.

round.description: The number of decimal places the generated number has. This is only used if `type` is `decimal` or `float`.

post.description: Generate random string based on type and length.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

type.description: Type of randomness. Specifies the character set to use when generating the random string.

length.description:
Type of randomness. Specifies the character set to use when generating the random string. The available types are: 
- **1**: Numbers only (0-9). 
- **2**: Alphabetical characters (both upper and lower case, A-Z, a-z). 
- **3**: Lowercase alphabetical characters only (a-z). 
- **4**: Uppercase alphabetical characters only (A-Z). 
- **5**: Alphanumeric characters with lowercase letters (a-z, 0-9). 
- **6**: Alphanumeric characters with uppercase letters (A-Z, 0-9). 
- **7**: Complex characters including special symbols (e.g., !, @, #, etc.). 
- **8**: Custom character set, which requires a custom array of characters to be provided.

custom.description: An array of custom characters to use for generating the random string. Required if type is set to 8.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

hue.description: The hue of the generated color. Default is random.

luminosity.description: The luminosity of the generated color. Default is random.

seed.description: A number or string that is used as a seed for the random number generator. By default, no seed is used.

format.description:
The format of the returned color. These are the possible formats:
- `rgb`: `rgb(0, 0, 0)`
- `rgba`: `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)`
- `hsl`: `hsl(0, 0%, 0%)`
- `hsla`: `hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0)`
- `hex`: `#000000`

Default is `hex`.

alpha.description: A decimal between 0 and 1 that specifies the value of the alpha channel. This is only relevant when using a format with an alpha channel. Default is a random value.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

amount.description: The amount of users to generate. Default is 1.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

header.description: Advanced header values. Only use if you know what you are doing.

algorithm.description: The signature algorithm to use. Default is `HS256`.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

verify.description: Whether to verify the JWT. This requires `secret`. Default is `false`.

secret.description: The HMAC secret or PEM-encoded public key.

algorithms.description: The signature algorithms that should be accepted. By default, all algorithms are accepted.

schema.description: The JWT payload.

post.description: Returns a QR code as a PNG image, styled using the provided settings.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com

data.description: The data that should be encoded

width.description: The width of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

height.description: The height of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

image.description: The URL of the image that should be put in the middle. By default, no image is used. The image covers up part of the QR code, which can only be recovered using error correction.

margin.description: The size of the space between the QR code and the border of the image in pixels. Default is 15.

qrOptions.description: Options for the QR code data.

typeNumber.description: The type of the QR code. This must be an integer between 1 and 40. The number of dots on each side of the QR code is 4 * type number + 17. If the type is too low to encode all data, the request will fail. By default, the QR code is sized as small as possible.

mode.description:
The mode of the QR code. This decides which characters are allowed in the QR code:

- `Numeric`: Only numbers from 0 to 9.
- `Alphanumeric`: Numbers from 0 to 9, latin letters from A to Z (only upper-case), spaces, and the following special characters: $, %, *, +, -, ., /, :.
- `Byte`: Any bytes.

For almost all cases, `Byte` is the correct choice, including for URLs. Default is `Byte`.

errorCorrectionLevel.description:
The error correction level. The higher the level is, the more likely it becomes the QR code can still be read in bad conditions, e.g. bad lighting, shaking, or when part of the code is hidden or destroyed. However, error correction also requires more data to be stored in the QR code, meaning the `typeNumber` will be higher. These are the approximate percentages of data that can be restored with the respective error correction levels:

- `L`: 7%
- `M`: 15%
- `Q`: 25%
- `H`: 30%

Default is `Q`.

imageOptions.description: Options for the image in the center of the QR code.

hideBackgroundDots.description: Whether the dots covered by the image should be hidden. Default is `true`.

margin.description: The size of the empty space around the image in pixels. Increasing the margin will decrease the image size. Default is 0.

dotsOptions.description: Options for the dots that make up most of the QR code.

type.description: The style of the dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the dots. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersSquareOptions.description: Options for the corner squares. This does not influence the smaller dots inside the corner squares.

type.description: The style of the corner squares. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner squares as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersDotOptions.description: Options for the corner dots. This does not influence the square border around the corner dots.

type.description: The style of the corner dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

post.description: Decodes a QR code from a URL or buffer and returns the encoded data. The supported file formats are `jpg`, `png`, `bmp`, `tiff`, `gif`.

body.description: Body from which to extract the text

greedy.description: When true, It include start and end marker in result.

caseSensitive.description: When true, It make the body case sensitive.

returnEmptyIfNotFound.description: When true, Return error if markers not found.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

buffer.description: The Base64-encoded buffer. Can be provided instead of `url`.

resultType.description: Result type specifies the output type.

workflow.description: A workflow outlines steps for processing documents, including analysis, extraction, and transformation. It uses unique identifiers to track and retrieve results for each document.

language.description: The language of the uploaded document.

documentType.description: The type of the uploaded document.

post.description: This endpoint generates a bar chart image based on the provided data, labels, and customization options.

data.description: Data points for the bar chart.

labels.description: Labels corresponding to the data points.

getAsUrl.description: If true, returns a URL instead of the chart image.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the chart image.

bordersColors.description: Colors for the borders of the bars.

barsColors.description: Colors for the bars in the chart.

borderWidth.description: Width of the borders around the bars.

fileName.description: Optional filename for the generated chart image.

post.description: This endpoint generates a doughnut chart image based on the provided data, labels, and customization options.

data.description: Data points for the doughnut chart.

labels.description: Labels corresponding to the data points.

getAsUrl.description: If true, returns a URL instead of the chart image.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the chart image.

bordersColors.description: Colors for the borders of the doughnut.

barsColors.description: Colors for the doughnut in the chart.

borderWidth.description: Width of the borders around the doughnut.

fileName.description: Optional filename for the generated chart image.

post.description: This endpoint generates a line chart image based on the provided data, labels, and customization options.

data.description: Data points for the line chart.

labels.description: Labels corresponding to the data points.

getAsUrl.description: If true, returns a URL instead of the chart image.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the chart image.

bordersColors.description: Colors for the borders of the line.

barsColors.description: Colors for the line in the chart.

fill.description: Fill the color under the line.

borderWidth.description: Width of the borders around the line.

fileName.description: Optional filename for the generated chart image.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

sigma.description: How strongly the image will be blurred.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

outputFormat.description: The output format of the conversion.

withMetaData.description: Whether the image metadata should be converted, too.

quality.description: Quality. Applies to JPEG, PNG, WEBP, TIFF. Default for JPEG, WEBP, TIFF is 80. Default for PNG is 100.

alphaQuality.description: Quality of alpha layer. Applies to WEBP. Default is 100.

lossless.description: Whether to use lossless compression. Applies to WEBP. Default is `false`.

nearLossless.description: Whether to use near_lossless compression. Applies to WEBP. Default is `false`.

smartSubsample.description: Whether to use high quality chroma subsampling. Applies to WEBP. Default is `false`.

progressive.description: Progressive (interlace) scan. Applies to JPEG, PNG, GIF. Default is false.

chromaSubsampling.description: Chroma subsampling settings. `4:4:4` prevents subsampling if `quality` is at most 90. Applies to JPEG. Default is `4:2:0`.

trellisQuanitsation.description: Whether to use trellis quantization. Applies to JPEG. Default is `false`.

overshootDeringing.description: Whether to apply overshoot deringing. Applies to JPEG. Default is `false`.

optimiseScans.description: Whether to use optimized progressive scans. This enables `progressive`. Applies to JPEG. Default is `false`.

optimiseCoding.description: Whether to use optimized Huffman coding tables. Applies to JPEG. Default is `true`.

quanitsationTable.description: The quantization table that will be used. Applies to JPEG. Default is 0.

mozjpeg.description: Whether to use mozjpeg defaults. Default is `false`.

compressionLevel.description: The zlib compression level. Applies to PNG. Default is 6.

adaptiveFiltering.description: Whether adaptive row filtering should be used. Applies to PNG. Default is `false`.

effort.description: CPU effort for compression. For PNG and GIF, 1 is fastest, 10 is slowest, and enables `palette`. Default is 7. For WEBP, 0 is fastest, 6 is slowest. Default is 4.

palette.description: Use a palette-based image with an alpha channel. Applies to PNG. Default is `false`.

colours.description: Maximum number of colors in palette. Applies to PNG and GIF. Default is 256.

dither.description: Level of Floyd-Steinberg error diffusion. Applies to PNG and GIF. Default is 1.0.

preset.description: Preset option. Applies to WEBP. Default is `default`.

compression.description: Compression option. Applies to TIFF. Default is `jpeg`.

predictor.description: Compression predictor setting. Applies to TIFF. Default is `horizontal`.

pyramid.description: Write an image pyramid. Applies to TIFF. Default is `false`.

tile.description: Enable tiling mode. Applies to TIFF. Deault is `false`.

tileWidth.description: Horizontal tile size. Only applies when `tile` is true. Applies to TIFF. Default is 256.

tileHeight.description: Vertical tile size. Only applies when `tile` is true. Applies to TIFF. Default is 256.

xres.description: Horizontal resolution in px/mm. Applies to TIFF. Default is 1.0.

yres.description: Vertical resolution in px/mm. Applies to TIFF. Default is 1.0.

bitdepth.description: Reduce bitdepth. Applies to TIFF. Default is 8.

miniswhite.description: Write 1-bit images as miniswhite. Applies to TIFF. Default is `false`.

resolutionUnit.description: Resolution unit. Applies to TIFF. Default is `inch`.

reuse.description: Re-use existing palette, otherwise generate new (slow). Applies to GIF. Default is `false`.

interFrameMaxError.description: Maximum inter-frame error for transparency. 0 means lossless. Applies to GIF. Default is 0.

interPaletteMaxError.description: Maximum inter-palette error for palette reuse. Default is 3.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

left.description: The number of pixels that should be cropped on the left.

top.description: The number of pixels that should be cropped on the top.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

exifData.description: The EXIF data of the image. For details, see https://exiv2.org/tags.html.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

axis.description: The axis the image will be flipped about.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

html.description: The HTML source. Can be specified instead of `url`.

type.description: The output image format. Default is `png`.

quality.description: The screenshot quality between 0 and 100. Does not apply to PNG. Default is 80.

fullPage.description: Whether to take a screenshot of the full page. Default is `false`.

defaultBackground.description: Whether to use the default background. Default is `true`.

emulateDevice.description: The name of the device that should be emulated. By default, no device is emulated.

width.description: The width of the screenshot in pixels. Default is 1920.

height.description: The height of the screenshot in pixels. Default is 1080.

scaleFactor.description: The device-specific scale factor. Default is 1.

darkMode.description: Whether to use dark mode. Default is `false`.

clip.description: The region the screenshot should capture.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

frontImageUrl.description: The URL of the front image.

backImageUrl.description: The URL of the background image.

position.description: The position of the front image on the back image. This overrides `options.horizontalPosition` and `options.verticalPosition`.

getAsUrl.description: Whether to return the result as a buffer or a URL. Default is buffer.

horizontalPosition.description: The horizontal position of the front image on the back image.

verticalPosition.description: The vertical position of the front image on the back image.

opacity.description: The opacity of the front image. `1` means fully opaque, `0` means fully transparent. The value is multiplied with the existing alpha channel of the image, i.e. transparent images work without this setting. Default is `1`.

type.description: The output image format, e.g. `jpeg` or `png`. Default is `jpeg`.

fileName.description: A custom file name. If this is not set, a randomly generated is used instead.

url.description: The URL of the overlayed image. Only available if `getAsUrl` is true.

fileName.description: The filename of the image, if one was provided.

fit.description:
How to resize the image to fit if both `width` and `height` are specified. Must be one of:
- `cover`: Crop the image so the entire dimensions are filled.
- `contain`: Do not crop the image, so parts of the result will be empty and the entire image is contained.
- `fill`: Stretch the image to fill the dimensions without cropping or empty space.
- `inside`: Resize the image to be as large as possible without width or height being greater than the desired dimensions.
- `outside`: Resize the image to be as small as possible without width or height being smaller than the desired dimensions.
Default is `cover`.

background.description: The color for the space not covered by the resized image. Default is black.

kernel.description:
The kernel that will be used for image reduction. Must be one of:
- `nearest`: Use nearest neighbor interpolation.
- `cubic`: Use a Catmull-Rom spline.
- `lanczos2`: Use a Lanczos kernel with a = 2.
- `lanczos3`: Use a Lanczos kernel with a = 3.
Default is `lanczos3`.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

background.description: The color of the space that is not occupied by the image after the rotation. Only used if `angle` is not a multiple of 90 degrees. Default is `#000000`.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

sigma.description: How strongly the image will be sharpened.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result image should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The file name of the result image. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The PDF as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is false.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image to draw.

imageBuffer.description: T?he image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `imageUrl`.

anchor.description: The part of the page on which the image should be drawn. Default is `center`.

align.description: The part of the image that should be aligned with the specified position. Default is the value of `anchor`.

x.description: The horizontal offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

y.description: The vertical offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

width.description: The width of the image in points. This or `height` has to be provided. If only `width` is provided, `height` is calculated automatically.

height.description: The height of the image in points. This or `width` has to be provided. If only `height` is provided, `width` is calculated automatically.

rotate.description: The counter-clockwise rotation of the image in degrees. Default is 0.

pages.description: The pages the image should be drawn onto. Given as a range of pages, where 1 means the first page and ^1 means the last page.

fileName.description: The file name the result PDF will have. Default is a random ID.

font.description: The font to use. Default is Helvetica.

align.description: The part of the text that should be aligned with the specified position. Default is the value of `anchor`.

x.description: The horizontal offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

y.description: The vertical offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

rotate.description: The counter-clockwise rotation of the text in degrees. Default is 0.

size.description: The font size in points. Default is 32.

color.description: The font color as a six-digit hexcode, i.e. RRGGBB. Default is 000000, i.e. black.

pages.description: The pages the text should be drawn onto. Given as a range of pages, where 1 means the first page and ^1 means the last page.

author.description: The new author of the PDF.

subject.description: The new subject of the PDF.

keywords.description: The new keywords of the PDF.

creator.description: The creator of the PDF, which is the software used to design it.

creationDate.description: The creation date of the PDF.

modificationDate.description: The last modification date of the PDF.

pageCount.description: The page count of the PDF.

width.description: The width of the page in points.

pdf.description: The PDF URL or Base64-encoded buffer.

filename.description: The PDF file name. Default is a random ID.

creator.description: The creator of the PDF, which is the software used to design it.

creationDate.description: The creation date of the PDF.

modificationDate.description: The last modification date of the PDF.

pageCount.description: The page count of the PDF.

filename.description: The file name that was passed in the request, or a random ID.

html.description: The HTML source. Can be specified instead of `url`

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The PDF file name. Default is a random ID.

scale.description: The scale of the web app. Default is 1.

displayHeaderFooter.description: Show header and footer. Default is false.

printBackground.description: Whether to include the background in the PDF. Default is `false`.

landscape.description: Whether the PDF should be in landscape orientation. Default is `false`.

format.description: The format of the result PDF. This overwrites the `width` and `height` settings.

width.description: The width of the result PDF. Either a number in points or a string with a unit.

height.description: The height of the result PDF. Either a number in points or a string with a unit.

preferCSSPageSize.description: Overwrite the `format`, `width` and `height` settings with the page size defined by CSS. Default is `false`.

margin.description: The margins of the output PDF. Default is no margins.

omitBackground.description: Do not use default white background, which makes the PDF transparent. Default is `false`.

markdownString.description: The Markdown source that will be converted to a PDF.

css.description: Custom CSS to change the Markdown look.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The PDF file name. Default is a random ID.

buffer.description: The PDF as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

pages.description: The pages that should be included in the merged document. By default, all pages are included. This is specified as comma-separated page ranges, where 1 means the first page and ^1 the last page.

pages.description: The page ranges that should be contained in the new PDF files. Every subdocument is given as a comma-separated range of pages, where 1 means the first page and ^1 means the last page.

interval.description: The number of pages that should be contained in every split PDF file. Can be specified instead of `pages`.

fileName.description: The file name prefix the result PDFs will have. Default is a random ID.

pdfUrls.description: The URLs of all split PDF files.

repeat.description: Repeats the image across the entire specified range of the PDF. Default is false

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image to draw.

imageBuffer.description: The image as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `imageUrl`.

anchor.description: The part of the page on which the image should be drawn. Default is `center`.

align.description: The part of the image that should be aligned with the specified position. Default is the value of `anchor`.

x.description: The horizontal offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

y.description: The vertical offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

width.description: The width of the image in points. This or `height` has to be provided. If only `width` is provided, `height` is calculated automatically.

height.description: The height of the image in points. This or `width` has to be provided. If only `height` is provided, `width` is calculated automatically.

rotate.description: The counter-clockwise rotation of the image in degrees. Default is 0.

spacing.description: The space between each image. It only applies if repeat is true. Default is 0.

opacity.description: The opacity of the given image. The range must be between 0 and 1. Default is 1.

pages.description: The pages the image should be drawn onto. Given as a range of pages, where 1 means the first page and ^1 means the last page. Default are all Pages.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is false.

repeat.description: Repeats the text across the entire specified range of the PDF. Default is false

font.description: The font to use. Default is Helvetica.

anchor.description: The part of the page on which the text should be drawn. Default is `center`.

align.description: The part of the text that should be aligned with the specified position. Default is the value of `anchor`.

x.description: The horizontal offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

y.description: The vertical offset in points relative to the anchor. Default is 0.

spacing.description: The space between each text. It only applies if repeat is true. Default is 0.

rotate.description: The counter-clockwise rotation of the text in degrees. Default is 0.

size.description: The font size in points. Default is 32.

color.description: The font color as a six-digit hexcode, i.e. RRGGBB. Default is 000000, i.e. black.

pages.description: The pages the text should be drawn onto. Given as a range of pages, where 1 means the first page and ^1 means the last page. Default are all Pages.

opacity.description: The opacity of the text. Must be between 0 and 1. Default is 1

post.description: Factur-X/Zugferd is a standard for digital invoices. The data is encoded into an XML, which is attached to a human-readable PDF file. This endpoint checks that the given PDF has an attached XML invoice, and validates it according to the Factur-X/Zugferd specification (level EN16931). It also returns the XML invoice for further processing.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be retrieved from 0codekit.com.

buffer.description: The PDF as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

valid.description: Whether the PDF is a valid Factur-X/Zugferd invoice (level EN16931).

errors.description: The errors that were generated during the validation of the XML invoice. Only set if `valid` is false.

post.summary: Embed a Factur-X/Zugferd XML into an existing PDF.
post.description: Factur-X/Zugferd is a standard for digital invoices. The data is encoded into an XML, which is attached to a human-readable PDF file. This endpoint embeds an existing XML invoice into a PDF file which is not yet a Factur-X/Zugferd invoice. It also validates that the XML is valid. To create a valid Factur-X/Zugferd invoice, the user has to guarantee that the provided PDF is in PDF/A format.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key that can be found on 0codekit.com.

schema.description: The API key that can be found on 0codekit.com.

buffer.description: The Base64-encoded PDF file. Can be specified instead of `url`.

xml.description: The Factur-X/Zugferd XML invoice that shall be embedded.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is `false`.

fileName.description: The PDF file name. Default is a random ID.

post.summary: Find the best match for a query string from a list of targets.
post.description: This function takes a query string and a list of target strings. It uses an LLM to find the best match(es), accounting for variations in the query string, and returns the closest match(es) based on the options provided.

queryString.description: The main string you want to match against the target list. Typically, this is the name or entity you are searching for.

context.description: A short description of the type of data being matched. This helps provide additional clarity for the AI in determining the best match.

targetList.description: The list of potential matches. Each entry in this list represents a possible candidate for matching with the query string.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of matches to return. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

anyOf.description: An array of matched strings if `maxResults` is greater than 1.
A single matched string if `maxResults` is 1.

post.summary: Extract a custom object from a given text.
post.description: This function takes a text input, a context for added relevance, and a list of fields with their descriptions. It leverages an LLM to extract the specified information from the text and organizes it into a structured object.

text.description: The text in which the information will be searched.
text.example: Greetings! I am Zog, an alien from planet Blip, 142 years old, and a passionate collector of cosmic dust.

context.example: A brief self-introduction from an alien applying for an intergalactic research role.

description.description: Prompt describing the kind of information that this field should contain.
description.example: Age of the alien. Just a number, no other text.

validationRegex.description: A regular expression that will be used to validate the value.

buffer.description: The PDF as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be specified instead of `url`.

sensitiveContent.description: A text prompt describing which data from the document should be covered.
sensitiveContent.example: All people names and addresses should be considered sensitive data.

fileName.description: The file name the result PDF will have. Default is a random ID.

getAsUrl.description: Whether the result PDF should be returned as a URL. Default is false.

language.description: The language of the document in ISO 639-1 nomenclature. Default is 'en' (English).

fileName.description: The name of the file.

post.summary: Merge audio into a video file with optional customizations.
post.description: Merges a video file and an audio file into a single video file, optionally applying various customizations like trimming, fading, and more.

video.description: The URL of the video file.

audio.description: The URL of the audio file.

fileName.description: The name of the merged video.

outputUrl.description: The URL where the merged video can be downloaded.
